intro: Sidalcea secundiflora, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Sidalcea secundiflora is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
